Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the failure of Republicans to deliver on their promise of higher wages for working families, as there has been some wage growth since President Trump took office.
Understate: The claim understates the increase in wages that has occurred under President Trump, as there has been a $6 increase in median usual weekly inflation-adjusted earnings for full-time wage and salary workers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide comprehensive data on wage growth under President Trump.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Republicans are solely responsible for delivering higher wages for working families, without considering other factors that may influence wage growth.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the level of wage growth, such as economic expansions and the influence of previous administrations.
